title: System element workflow
content:
This section describes the metaphases and subordinate phases in the life cycle of a system element.

The system element workflow relies on business rules. Rules repeat from one phase to another when the end user can make a change to a field modified by a business rule during that phase. For more information about the out-of-the-box business rules defined for the system element workflow, see System element process - Business rules.

Metaphase: In use

The subordinate phase is In use.

Phase Transition Description
In use Manual

An active system element is In use that supports a service component.

Next phase: Ended

Example: a database or a web server.

Metaphase: End of life (End)

The subordinate phase is Ended.

Phase Transition Description
Ended Manual

The system element is no longer available.

Next phase: None, or you can return to In use

Example: you can return the system element to service by returning it to the In use phase.

  • System elements
  • How to create a system element record
  • How to edit a system element record
  • How to delete a system element record
  • How to view an impact map for a system element
